intro: Ageratum paleaceum, commonly known as the white ageratum, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30 to 60 centimeters, with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, with a central yellow disk, and bloom during the summer months. Ageratum paleaceum is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in gardens and floral arrangements due to its vibrant appearance and ability to attract pollinators.
